byline.contributor: Neil Marks reported from Georgetown, and Benjamin Mueller from New York. Reporting was contributed by Kate Pastor, Liz Robbins, Rick Rojas, Kirk Semple and Alex Vadukul from New York.
byline.original: By NEIL MARKS and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Death of New York City Police Officer Randolph Holder, who was shot while on job in East Harlem, has had profound effect on his family in United States as well as in his native Guyana.
lead_paragraph: Officer Holder, 33, who was fatally shot Tuesday night, was a Guyanese immigrant who joined the Police Department five years ago. “It was something that he loved to do,” a relative said.

headline.main: Death of Randolph Holder, New York Officer, Reverberates Across Continents
headline.print_headline: Death of Officer Who Pursued the Family Trade Reverberates Across Continents

snippet: Officer Holder, 33, who was fatally shot Tuesday night, was a Guyanese immigrant who joined the Police Department five years ago. “It was something that he loved to do,” a relative said.
